channel.title: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?
channel.description: Ok well,since the new rs combat level is 138 cb,i wanted to make my server 138 cb,i want theiving to give combat,so when you get 99 thieveing and 99 all cb levels,you will be 138,anyone know how to do this?or is it impossible?please help :confused:

item.title: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: @deathbadger deathbadger
item.description:
@deathbadger wrote:

ok well if i can’t add combat to noncombat skills,is it possible to make it where only 1 stat goes higher then 99,to make a 138 cb?

Read full topic

You might be able to change what XP the skill gives to another skill in client.java[/quote]lol, love that commeercial

item.title: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

NOIdea if this would work but what if you did:

[code]TheifStall("gem stall", "and recieve 550k", 60, 9000*playerLevel[0][17], 995, 350000, 30, 0x340);

Or something around that? I doubt it would work but everythign is worth trying. I made it say [0][17], maybe that would add it to both? Not really sure didn’t test it.[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?

that would work but it is given the xp to attack and your teiving would be 0

item.source: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?

item.title: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

like if you wanted to make theifing xp give attack xp instead, lookf or something like this in client.java:

TheifStall("gem stall", "and recieve 550k", 60, 9000*playerLevel[17], 995, 350000, 30, 0x340);

See where it says playerLevel[17]? That means its giving it to theifing. Simply change it to the attack skill. I think attack is 0. So it would be:

[code]TheifStall("gem stall", "and recieve 550k", 60, 9000*playerLevel[0], 995, 350000, 30, 0x340);[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Making Noncombat Stats Give Combat,Is It Possible?
